top_comments.comment: <<I will always let  anyone know to forget predictions and start making good profit now because future valuations are all speculations and guesses.The market is very unstable and you can't tell if it's going bearish or bullish.While myself and others are trading without fear of making a loss others are being patient for the price to skyrocket. It all depends on the pattern you follow.I was able to make 11 bTC in just August from implementing  trades with tips and info from Davis Thomas..

🤔Why am I Thinking about unsubscribing Business Insider?.....

🏁Myself from the place 'Idukki' which the documentary was mentioning about, am confused by the fact why the documentary completely ignored " PESTICIDES" which has a huge impact on the  cost of production. Its impact is so big as it costs almost equal and sometimes more than the fertilizers.

🌽The cardamom plant species widely used in the region, just like any other commercial crop, focuses on the productivity and with a low immunity from pests. The other factors that made the plant more vulnerable to pests might be the unscientific usage of chemical fertilizers which affected the organic structures of the soil.
🍒Add on: The pesticides are used very frequently with the most average time period of 15 days. And we must not ignore the fact that a small village in area had the most number of cancer patients in the state.  

🍉Last piece: (reason for the title which can also be read as a click bait) The channel/director has either intentionally ignored the factor just to make the documentary feel positive or has not done genuine research on the subject. 

Thank you🍷

comments_since_last_sample.body: The biggest producer of green cardamom is a country in Central America. I think it is either Guatemala or Nicaragua.
Life as we know it will stop on India without  cardamom.
We are from the indian spice city here we dont got enough  money the middle persons took all the profit
